alert.note: Alert for La Paz (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 12 at 5:32AM MST until September 12 at 7:45AM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern La Paz County in west central Arizona... * Until 745 AM MST. * At 532 AM MST, Doppler radar continues to indicate thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. This includes the following streams and drainages... Cunningham Wash, Bouse Wash, Date Creek, Bullard Wash, Centennial Wash and Santa Maria River. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
